terms.definition: Death of heart muscle tissue due to lack of blood supply, commonly known as a heart attack
examples: The patient presented with chest pain and was diagnosed with an acute myocardial infarction

terms.definition: High blood pressure, defined as systolic pressure ≥140 mmHg or diastolic pressure ≥90 mmHg
examples: Chronic hypertension increases the risk of stroke and kidney disease

terms.definition: Irregular heartbeat or abnormal heart rhythm
examples: The ECG showed atrial fibrillation, a common type of arrhythmia

terms.definition: Hardening and narrowing of arteries due to plaque buildup
examples: Atherosclerosis in the coronary arteries can lead to angina and heart attacks

terms.definition: Disease of the heart muscle that affects its ability to pump blood effectively
examples: Dilated cardiomyopathy resulted in the patient's heart failure symptoms

terms.definition: Infection that inflames air sacs in one or both lungs, which may fill with fluid
examples: Bacterial pneumonia was confirmed with chest X-ray and sputum culture

terms.definition: Chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and breathing difficulties
terms.etymology: From Greek 'asthma' meaning panting or short breath
examples: The child's asthma was triggered by exposure to dust mites

terms.definition: Collapsed lung caused by air leaking into the space between lung and chest wall
examples: Spontaneous pneumothorax required immediate chest tube insertion

terms.definition: Inflammation of the bronchial tubes that carry air to the lungs
examples: Acute bronchitis typically resolves within 2-3 weeks with supportive care

terms.definition: Abnormal accumulation of fluid in the pleural space around the lungs
terms.etymology: Pleural (relating to pleura) + effusion (pouring out of fluid)
examples: Thoracentesis was performed to drain the pleural effusion and relieve dyspnea

terms.definition: Sudden interruption of blood flow to the brain, causing brain tissue damage
terms.etymology: From Old English meaning 'a blow or strike'
examples: The patient showed signs of acute stroke with left-sided weakness and speech difficulties

terms.definition: Sudden, uncontrolled electrical disturbance in the brain
terms.etymology: From Old French 'seisir' meaning to take possession
examples: The generalized tonic-clonic seizure lasted three minutes

terms.definition: Severe headache often accompanied by nausea, vomiting, and light sensitivity
examples: Her migraine attacks occur monthly and respond well to triptans

terms.definition: Damage or dysfunction of peripheral nerves, often causing pain and numbness
examples: Diabetic neuropathy caused tingling and burning sensation in his feet

terms.definition: Inflammation of the brain tissue, often caused by viral infection
examples: Viral encephalitis was suspected based on fever, headache, and altered mental status

terms.definition: Most serious type of skin cancer that develops in melanocytes
examples: Early detection of melanoma significantly improves treatment outcomes

terms.definition: General term for skin inflammation causing redness, swelling, and itching
examples: Contact dermatitis developed after exposure to poison ivy

terms.definition: Chronic skin condition causing dry, itchy, and inflamed skin patches
terms.etymology: From Greek 'ekzema' meaning to boil over
examples: Atopic eczema in children often improves with age and proper skin care

terms.definition: Autoimmune condition causing rapid skin cell turnover and scaly patches
examples: Plaque psoriasis commonly affects elbows, knees, and scalp

terms.definition: Bacterial skin infection affecting deeper layers of skin and soft tissue
examples: Cellulitis of the lower leg required immediate antibiotic treatment

terms.definition: Break in the continuity of bone tissue
examples: The X-ray revealed a displaced fracture of the radius bone

terms.definition: Inflammation of joints causing pain, stiffness, and reduced range of motion
examples: Rheumatoid arthritis affects multiple joints symmetrically

terms.definition: Condition where bones become weak and brittle due to loss of bone density
examples: Postmenopausal women are at increased risk for osteoporosis

terms.definition: Inflammation of tendons, often due to overuse or repetitive motion
examples: Tennis elbow is a common form of tendonitis affecting the lateral epicondyle

terms.definition: Age-related wear and tear affecting the spinal discs and vertebrae
examples: Cervical spondylosis can cause neck pain and arm numbness

terms.definition: Inflammation of the stomach lining often caused by H. pylori bacteria or NSAIDs
examples: Chronic gastritis can lead to peptic ulcers if left untreated

terms.definition: Inflammation of the appendix requiring emergency surgical removal
examples: Acute appendicitis presents with right lower quadrant abdominal pain

terms.definition: Yellow discoloration of skin and eyes due to elevated bilirubin levels
examples: Obstructive jaundice may indicate gallstone blockage of the bile duct

terms.definition: Chronic liver disease characterized by scarring and loss of liver function
examples: Alcohol-related cirrhosis can progress to liver failure

terms.definition: Inflammatory bowel disease causing ulcers in the colon and rectum
examples: Ulcerative colitis symptoms include bloody diarrhea and abdominal cramping

terms.definition: Group of metabolic disorders characterized by high blood glucose levels
examples: Type 2 diabetes mellitus is often managed with lifestyle changes and medication

terms.definition: Condition where the thyroid gland doesn't produce enough thyroid hormone
examples: Hypothyroidism can cause fatigue, weight gain, and cold intolerance

terms.definition: Condition where the thyroid gland produces too much thyroid hormone
examples: Hyperthyroidism can cause rapid heartbeat, weight loss, and anxiety

terms.definition: Disorder caused by prolonged exposure to high levels of cortisol
examples: Cushing's syndrome can cause moon face, purple striae, and muscle weakness

terms.definition: Primary adrenal insufficiency caused by destruction of the adrenal cortex
examples: Addison's disease can cause fatigue, weight loss, and skin hyperpigmentation

terms.definition: Condition where blood doesn't have enough healthy red blood cells or hemoglobin
examples: Iron deficiency anemia is the most common type of anemia worldwide

terms.definition: Cancer of the blood-forming tissues, including bone marrow and lymphatic system
examples: Acute lymphoblastic leukemia is the most common childhood cancer

terms.definition: Condition characterized by abnormally low platelet count in the blood
examples: Thrombocytopenia can cause easy bruising and prolonged bleeding

terms.definition: Inherited bleeding disorder where blood doesn't clot properly
examples: Hemophilia A is caused by deficiency of clotting factor VIII

terms.definition: Condition characterized by increased red blood cell mass
examples: Polycythemia vera is a myeloproliferative disorder affecting red blood cell production

terms.definition: Type of cancer that begins in epithelial cells lining organs and tissues
examples: Lung adenocarcinoma is the most common type of lung cancer

terms.definition: Type of cancer that develops in connective tissues like bone, muscle, or cartilage
examples: Osteosarcoma is the most common primary bone tumor in children

terms.definition: Cancer that begins in lymphocytes (white blood cells) of the immune system
examples: Hodgkin lymphoma typically spreads from one lymph node to adjacent nodes

terms.definition: Spread of cancer cells from the primary tumor to distant parts of the body
examples: Liver metastasis was discovered during staging of the patient's colorectal cancer

terms.definition: Treatment using drugs to destroy or slow the growth of cancer cells
examples: Adjuvant chemotherapy is given after surgery to eliminate remaining cancer cells

terms.definition: Presence of blood in the urine
examples: Gross hematuria was visible to the naked eye, indicating significant bleeding

terms.definition: Inflammation of the kidneys, particularly the glomeruli
examples: Acute glomerulonephritis can follow a streptococcal infection

terms.definition: Condition caused by accumulation of waste products in blood due to kidney failure
examples: Severe uremia requires immediate dialysis to remove accumulated toxins

terms.definition: Inflammation of the bladder, commonly caused by bacterial infection
examples: Bacterial cystitis is more common in women due to shorter urethral length

terms.definition: Inflammation of the prostate gland
examples: Chronic prostatitis can cause pelvic pain and urinary symptoms

terms.definition: Absence of menstrual periods in women of reproductive age
examples: Primary amenorrhea refers to the absence of menarche by age 15

terms.definition: Painful menstrual periods involving cramping pain in the lower abdomen
examples: Secondary dysmenorrhea may indicate underlying conditions like endometriosis

terms.definition: Condition where endometrial tissue grows outside the uterus
examples: Endometriosis can cause severe dysmenorrhea and may lead to infertility

terms.definition: Pregnancy complication characterized by high blood pressure and protein in urine
examples: Severe preeclampsia requires immediate delivery to prevent maternal complications

terms.definition: Inflammation of the cervix, often caused by sexually transmitted infections
examples: Chronic cervicitis may be detected during routine Pap smear examination

terms.definition: Having or relating to fever; feverish
examples: The febrile child was given acetaminophen to reduce the fever

terms.definition: Respiratory infection causing swelling around vocal cords and distinctive barking cough
terms.etymology: From Scots 'croup' meaning to cry hoarsely
examples: Croup typically affects children between 6 months and 6 years of age

terms.definition: Yellowing of skin and eyes due to elevated bilirubin, common in newborns
examples: Physiologic jaundice in newborns typically appears on day 2-3 of life

terms.definition: Poor physical growth and development in infants and children
examples: Failure to thrive may result from inadequate nutrition or underlying medical conditions

terms.definition: Present from birth; referring to conditions existing at or before birth
examples: Congenital heart defects are the most common type of birth defect

terms.definition: Process of determining priority of patient treatment based on severity of condition
terms.etymology: From French 'trier' meaning to sort or select
examples: Emergency department triage ensures the most critical patients are seen first

terms.definition: Process of reviving someone from apparent death or unconsciousness
examples: Cardiopulmonary resuscitation was performed for 20 minutes before return of pulse

terms.definition: Physical injury caused by external force or violence
examples: Blunt abdominal trauma was suspected after the motor vehicle accident

terms.definition: Life-threatening condition where organs don't receive adequate blood flow and oxygen
examples: Hemorrhagic shock developed rapidly after the patient's traumatic injury

terms.definition: Insertion of a tube into the trachea to maintain an open airway
examples: Emergency intubation was performed due to the patient's respiratory failure

terms.definition: Medication that relieves pain without causing loss of consciousness
examples: Nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drugs are commonly used analgesics

terms.definition: Medication that kills bacteria or inhibits their growth
examples: Broad-spectrum antibiotics are used when the causative organism is unknown

terms.definition: Medication that increases urine production and promotes fluid elimination
examples: Loop diuretics are commonly prescribed for patients with heart failure

terms.definition: Medication that widens blood vessels and reduces blood pressure
examples: Nitroglycerin is a vasodilator used to treat angina

terms.definition: Medication that reduces the activity of the immune system
examples: Immunosuppressants are essential to prevent organ transplant rejection

terms.definition: Surgical cut made into tissue, typically to access internal structures
terms.etymology: From Latin 'incisio' meaning a cutting into
examples: A midline abdominal incision was made to access the peritoneal cavity

terms.definition: Surgical connection between two structures, typically blood vessels or bowel segments
examples: Vascular anastomosis was performed to restore blood flow after vessel repair

terms.definition: Minimally invasive surgery using small incisions and a camera-equipped instrument
examples: Laparoscopic cholecystectomy has become the gold standard for gallbladder removal

terms.definition: Surgical removal of dead, damaged, or infected tissue to promote healing
terms.etymology: From French 'debrider' meaning to remove constraints
examples: Sharp debridement was performed to remove necrotic tissue from the wound

terms.definition: Process of stopping bleeding, either naturally or surgically
examples: Adequate hemostasis was achieved using electrocautery during the procedure

terms.definition: Slow heart rate, typically less than 60 beats per minute in adults
examples: Sinus bradycardia is common in well-trained athletes

terms.definition: Fast heart rate, typically over 100 beats per minute in adults at rest
examples: Supraventricular tachycardia was terminated with vagal maneuvers

terms.definition: Chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart muscle
examples: Stable angina typically occurs with exertion and resolves with rest

terms.definition: Blockage of blood vessel by a clot, air bubble, or other foreign material
examples: Pulmonary embolism was suspected in the patient with sudden dyspnea

terms.definition: Inflammation of the pericardium, the sac surrounding the heart
examples: Acute pericarditis often presents with sharp, pleuritic chest pain

terms.definition: Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath
examples: Exertional dyspnea is a common symptom of heart failure

terms.definition: Deficiency of oxygen in tissues
examples: Tissue hypoxia can result from various respiratory or circulatory conditions

terms.definition: Collapse or incomplete expansion of lung tissue
examples: Postoperative atelectasis is a common complication after abdominal surgery

terms.definition: Lung disease causing destruction of alveoli and difficulty breathing
examples: Pulmonary emphysema is primarily caused by long-term smoking

terms.definition: Formation of excess fibrous connective tissue in an organ
examples: Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis causes progressive scarring of lung tissue

terms.definition: Paralysis of one side of the body
examples: Left hemiplegia resulted from the patient's right-sided stroke

terms.definition: Loss of ability to understand or express speech due to brain damage
examples: Broca's aphasia affects speech production while comprehension remains intact

terms.definition: Lack of muscle coordination affecting movement and balance
examples: Cerebellar ataxia causes unsteady gait and difficulty with fine motor tasks

terms.definition: Muscle pain or ache
examples: Viral infections commonly cause generalized myalgia

terms.definition: Abnormal sensation such as tingling, numbness, or burning
examples: Paresthesias in the hands may indicate carpal tunnel syndrome

terms.definition: Skin condition characterized by raised, itchy welts (hives)
examples: Acute urticaria often resolves within 24 hours without treatment

terms.definition: Hair loss or baldness
terms.etymology: From Greek 'alopex' meaning fox (referring to patchy hair loss)
examples: Alopecia areata causes patchy hair loss in otherwise healthy individuals

terms.definition: Excessive secretion of sebum by sebaceous glands
examples: Seborrheic dermatitis commonly affects the scalp and face

terms.definition: Thickening of the outer layer of skin
examples: Actinic keratosis is considered a precancerous skin lesion

terms.definition: Autoimmune condition causing loss of skin pigmentation in patches
examples: Vitiligo results from autoimmune destruction of melanocytes

terms.definition: Excessive inward curvature of the spine, typically in the lower back
examples: Excessive lumbar lordosis can cause lower back pain and postural problems

terms.definition: Excessive outward curvature of the spine, causing a hunched appearance
examples: Thoracic kyphosis may develop due to osteoporotic compression fractures

terms.definition: Lateral curvature of the spine
examples: Adolescent idiopathic scoliosis is the most common form of spinal curvature

terms.definition: Inflammation of the fluid-filled sacs (bursae) that cushion joints
examples: Subdeltoid bursitis commonly causes shoulder pain and limited range of motion

terms.definition: Inflammation of muscle tissue
examples: Polymyositis is an autoimmune form of myositis affecting multiple muscle groups

categories.description: Urinary system and male reproductive conditions
